Mesh raster

Source: R/mesh_raster.R
mesh_raster.Rd

Create a raster by interpolating across triangles

mesh_raster(x, grid = NULL, n = 128)

# S3 method for mesh3d
mesh_raster(x, grid = NULL, n = 128)

# S3 method for matrix
mesh_raster(x, grid = NULL, n = 128)

# S3 method for data.frame
mesh_raster(x, grid = NULL, n = 128)

Arguments

x

matrix of points, or a mesh3d
grid

raster to populate
n

grid size of raster if 'grid' not supplied

Value

Raster

Details

Barycentric interpolation is used to efficiently obtain a within-triangle estimate of a field of values

Examples

data("humface", package = "Rvcg")
x <- humface
grid <- mesh_raster(x, n = 256)
raster::plot(grid, col = grey.colors(21),
    breaks = quantile(grid, seq(0, 1, length = 22), na.rm = TRUE))
anglr::plot3d(grid)
